Accountant Job at Talent Towers




        
    

        
        Talent Towers -  Our client, one of Nigeria’s leading multi-location dental service providers, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a Chartered Accountant to join the Port Harcourt team.
	As a modern healthcare organization committed to excellence, we rely on accurate financial reporting, transparent operations, and professional ethics.
	If you are detail-oriented and passionate about supporting a healthcare business that helps people smile with confidence, this role is for you.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage branch-level financial accounting, reconciliations, and reporting
	Ensure accurate bookkeeping and alignment with corporate financial standards
	Monitor revenue, expenses, and operational financial activities
	Support budgeting, inventory accounting, and cost control
	Ensure compliance with tax, audit, and statutory obligations
	Collaborate with clinic leadership to improve financial efficiency


Requirements


	Chartered Accountant (ICAN/ACCA certified) — Mandatory
	2–4 years of accounting experience (healthcare experience is an advantage)
	Strong proficiency in accounting tools and Excel
	Excellent integrity, professionalism, and attention to detail.


Salary
N500,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@talenttowers.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates would be contacted.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Property Broker",
  "description": "Property Brokers Magazine is a comprehensive property and security solutions provider that leverages intelligent security solutions supported by civilized guards with its global security technology partnerships; we have been able to secure the trust of residential, commercial, government, and industrial customers throughout Nigeria and beyond.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Property Broker

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Real Estate Professional is responsible for managing property sales, leasing, acquisition, marketing, and client relations to drive profitability and growth.
	The role involves market research, negotiation, and strategic management of real estate portfolios to optimize value and ensure client satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities
Property Sales and Leasing:


	Manage and execute property sales, lease negotiations, and renewals.
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities and prospective clients.
	Conduct property inspections, valuations, and client viewings.
	Prepare and manage listing documents, lease agreements, and transaction records.


Market Research and Analysis:


	Conduct real estate market studies to identify trends, pricing, and investment opportunities.
	Provide data-driven insights and advice on property acquisition, development, and disposition.
	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of zoning laws, property regulations, and market conditions.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, investors, landlords, and tenants.
	Provide professional advisory services and after-sale support.
	Develop marketing strategies to attract potential buyers, tenants, and investors.


Marketing and Business Development:


	Promote properties through advertising, social media, events, and professional networks.
	Collaborate with marketing teams to develop promotional materials and campaigns.
	Represent the organization at exhibitions, property fairs, and networking events.


Documentation and Compliance:


	Ensure all property transactions comply with legal, regulatory, and company standards.
	Manage documentation such as title deeds, lease agreements, and client contracts.
	Liaise with government agencies, surveyors, lawyers, and financial institutions.


Performance Indicators


	Achievement of sales and leasing targets.
	Growth in client base and portfolio value.
	Timely completion of transactions and compliance with standards.
	Client satisfaction and retention levels.


Education and Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Estate Management, Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
	3&ndash;5 years of experience in property sales, leasing, or real estate advisory.
	Professional certification (e.g., NIESV, ARCON, RICS) is an added advantage.


Key Competencies and Skills:


	Excellent negotiation and communication skills.
	Strong knowledge of property markets and investment principles.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and meet deadlines.
	Customer-focused with strong networking abilities.
	Analytical thinking and attention to detail.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter in PDF as a single document to:&nbsp;hadaba.gresource@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Property Broker Job at Property Brokers International Magazine Limited




        
    

        
        Property Brokers Magazine is a comprehensive property and security solutions provider that leverages intelligent security solutions supported by civilized guards with its global security technology partnerships; we have been able to secure the trust of residential, commercial, government, and industrial customers throughout Nigeria and beyond.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Property Broker

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Real Estate Professional is responsible for managing property sales, leasing, acquisition, marketing, and client relations to drive profitability and growth.
	The role involves market research, negotiation, and strategic management of real estate portfolios to optimize value and ensure client satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities
Property Sales and Leasing:


	Manage and execute property sales, lease negotiations, and renewals.
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities and prospective clients.
	Conduct property inspections, valuations, and client viewings.
	Prepare and manage listing documents, lease agreements, and transaction records.


Market Research and Analysis:


	Conduct real estate market studies to identify trends, pricing, and investment opportunities.
	Provide data-driven insights and advice on property acquisition, development, and disposition.
	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of zoning laws, property regulations, and market conditions.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, investors, landlords, and tenants.
	Provide professional advisory services and after-sale support.
	Develop marketing strategies to attract potential buyers, tenants, and investors.


Marketing and Business Development:


	Promote properties through advertising, social media, events, and professional networks.
	Collaborate with marketing teams to develop promotional materials and campaigns.
	Represent the organization at exhibitions, property fairs, and networking events.


Documentation and Compliance:


	Ensure all property transactions comply with legal, regulatory, and company standards.
	Manage documentation such as title deeds, lease agreements, and client contracts.
	Liaise with government agencies, surveyors, lawyers, and financial institutions.


Performance Indicators


	Achievement of sales and leasing targets.
	Growth in client base and portfolio value.
	Timely completion of transactions and compliance with standards.
	Client satisfaction and retention levels.


Education and Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Estate Management, Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
	3–5 years of experience in property sales, leasing, or real estate advisory.
	Professional certification (e.g., NIESV, ARCON, RICS) is an added advantage.


Key Competencies and Skills:


	Excellent negotiation and communication skills.
	Strong knowledge of property markets and investment principles.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and meet deadlines.
	Customer-focused with strong networking abilities.
	Analytical thinking and attention to detail.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter in PDF as a single document to: hadaba.gresource@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior DevOps Engineer",
  "description": "Platinumlist.net, a pioneering leader in the online event guide and ticketing solution industry, has been revolutionizing the event landscape in the Gulf region since 2009. As the largest ticketing provider in the GCC, we proudly serve an extensive array of events across the United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia, Oman, Bahrain, Qatar, and Kuwait from our Dubai-based headquarters.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Senior DevOps Engineer - AWS Cloud Hosting Platform

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria

About the Role


	We&rsquo;re looking for a Senior DevOps / SRE Engineer to own and evolve our AWS infrastructure with a strong focus on reliability, scalability, performance under peak load, and safe delivery of new AWS capabilities.
	You&rsquo;ll partner with engineering teams to ensure our platform stays fast and resilient during traffic spikes while continuously improving automation, observability, security, and cost efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Own production reliability on AWS: availability, latency, throughput, capacity, and incident response.
	Architect and operate scalable infrastructure (multi-AZ as a baseline; DR strategy and regular testing).
	Build and maintain Infrastructure as Code (Terraform / CloudFormation / CDK) and Git-based workflows.
	Improve CI/CD pipelines and deployment strategies (blue/green, canary, progressive delivery).
	Implement strong observability: metrics, logs, traces, alerting, dashboards; define SLO/SLI and reduce noise.
	Own database operations on AWS (Aurora/RDS MySQL): backups/restores (including restore drills), read replicas, performance troubleshooting, and capacity planning.
	Improve caching and traffic handling (CDN, Redis/ElastiCache, queues) to sustain peak demand.
	Harden security posture: IAM least privilege, secrets management, patching, WAF, audit trails.
	Drive adoption of relevant AWS managed services (where it increases reliability and reduces ops burden).
	Drive cloud cost efficiency (FinOps): cost visibility, tagging, budgets/alerts, rightsizing, and smart usage of AWS pricing models without compromising reliability.
	Lead post-incident reviews (RCA, corrective actions, prevention), and ensure improvements are implemented and verified.


Requirements


	10+ years of experience in similar role.
	Strong hands-on AWS in production (typical stack: VPC, IAM, EC2, ALB/NLB, Auto Scaling, S3, CloudFront, Route53, CloudWatch/CloudTrail, WAF; plus Aurora/RDS).
	Proven experience designing/operating high-load web systems with strict uptime requirements.
	IaC and automation mindset (Terraform/CloudFormation/CDK + scripting Bash/Python).
	Production MySQL on AWS (Aurora/RDS): backups &amp; restores (including restore drills), read replicas, monitoring, and performance troubleshooting.
	Ability to troubleshoot production web stacks (Nginx + PHP-FPM) and identify bottlenecks across app &harr; DB &harr; infrastructure.
	Containers and deployment automation (ECS/EKS, Docker; understanding of scaling and rollout patterns).
	Solid Linux + networking fundamentals (DNS, TLS, routing, LB, troubleshooting).
	Observability practices and incident management experience.
	Must be reachable for critical production incidents; occasional after-hours support may be required (critical-only).


Nice-to-have:


	PHP ecosystem familiarity (PHP-FPM/Nginx, Composer; Laravel/Symfony is a plus).
	MySQL internals/performance tuning and advanced replication/proxying (e.g., ProxySQL).
	Serverless &amp; event-driven AWS (Lambda, SQS/SNS, EventBridge, Step Functions).
	Security &amp; compliance frameworks; chaos testing/load testing.


Benefits


	Competitive salary.
	Remote-friendly work setup.
	A chance to make a real impact in a fast-growing market.
	Space to grow, experiment, and push boundaries.
",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-27",

    "@type": "Organization",

Job Position: Senior DevOps Engineer - AWS Cloud Hosting Platform

Job Location: Nigeria

About the Role

	We’re looking for a Senior DevOps / SRE Engineer to own and evolve our AWS infrastructure with a strong focus on reliability, scalability, performance under peak load, and safe delivery of new AWS capabilities.
	You’ll partner with engineering teams to ensure our platform stays fast and resilient during traffic spikes while continuously improving automation, observability, security, and cost efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Own production reliability on AWS: availability, latency, throughput, capacity, and incident response.
	Architect and operate scalable infrastructure (multi-AZ as a baseline; DR strategy and regular testing).
	Build and maintain Infrastructure as Code (Terraform / CloudFormation / CDK) and Git-based workflows.
	Improve CI/CD pipelines and deployment strategies (blue/green, canary, progressive delivery).
	Implement strong observability: metrics, logs, traces, alerting, dashboards; define SLO/SLI and reduce noise.
	Own database operations on AWS (Aurora/RDS MySQL): backups/restores (including restore drills), read replicas, performance troubleshooting, and capacity planning.
	Improve caching and traffic handling (CDN, Redis/ElastiCache, queues) to sustain peak demand.
	Harden security posture: IAM least privilege, secrets management, patching, WAF, audit trails.
	Drive adoption of relevant AWS managed services (where it increases reliability and reduces ops burden).
	Drive cloud cost efficiency (FinOps): cost visibility, tagging, budgets/alerts, rightsizing, and smart usage of AWS pricing models without compromising reliability.
	Lead post-incident reviews (RCA, corrective actions, prevention), and ensure improvements are implemented and verified.


Requirements


	10+ years of experience in similar role.
	Strong hands-on AWS in production (typical stack: VPC, IAM, EC2, ALB/NLB, Auto Scaling, S3, CloudFront, Route53, CloudWatch/CloudTrail, WAF; plus Aurora/RDS).
	Proven experience designing/operating high-load web systems with strict uptime requirements.
	IaC and automation mindset (Terraform/CloudFormation/CDK + scripting Bash/Python).
	Production MySQL on AWS (Aurora/RDS): backups & restores (including restore drills), read replicas, monitoring, and performance troubleshooting.
	Ability to troubleshoot production web stacks (Nginx + PHP-FPM) and identify bottlenecks across app ↔ DB ↔ infrastructure.
	Containers and deployment automation (ECS/EKS, Docker; understanding of scaling and rollout patterns).
	Solid Linux + networking fundamentals (DNS, TLS, routing, LB, troubleshooting).
	Observability practices and incident management experience.
	Must be reachable for critical production incidents; occasional after-hours support may be required (critical-only).


Nice-to-have:


	PHP ecosystem familiarity (PHP-FPM/Nginx, Composer; Laravel/Symfony is a plus).
	MySQL internals/performance tuning and advanced replication/proxying (e.g., ProxySQL).
	Serverless & event-driven AWS (Lambda, SQS/SNS, EventBridge, Step Functions).
	Security & compliance frameworks; chaos testing/load testing.


Benefits


	Competitive salary.
	Remote-friendly work setup.
	A chance to make a real impact in a fast-growing market.
	Space to grow, experiment, and push boundaries.
